nodes.title: Use /config/config.yml because it is more friendly to kubernetes.
Add support for Cloudwatch extended statistics
Avoid generating duplicate help text for DynamoDB
Replace AUTHORS.md by an updated MAINTAINERS.md
Upgrade pom.xml dependencies for proxy support
Change documentation to reflect JSON configuration file
Add simple home page to cloudwatch exporter
Address #28 by using AWS-SDK to fetch monitoring endpoint.
introduce optional role_arn for retrieving cross account metrics.
updated dependency version for AWS Java SDK Cloudwatch to 1.10.34
Added YAML support, updated example config

Rename again, OSX is case insensitive so this didn't propagate.
Don't request the freshest data, wait a bit.
update circleci to build multi-arch images
Refer to ECS exporter in README
Update example.yml with correct ELB values
Bumping version of Jetty to one with less open CVEs
Replace deprecated MAINTAINER statement in Dockerfile
Update to client_java 0.10.0 to pull in OpenMetrics support.
Use non-root user for Docker image
Add logging implementation for AWS SDK
Pull latest openjdk:11 base image when building the Docker image
Fixes #297. Single aws_resource_info per tag_selection metric block
Use `RecentlyActive` feature to only list metrics older than 3 hours when necessary

allow maven-compiler-plugin to compile without a JDK downgrade
Implement describe() to prevent the scrape on startup
Handle dynamo metrics without configured dimensions.
correct config.yml steps for building own image

Only close file if we opened a file.
add version, help, and debug flag, debug logging (no apache commons CLI dependency)

fix example.yml to use proper config names
Update HealthServlet to issue 5xx reponses when there are scrape errors

docs: Fix indentation on example config
Cloudwatch does not always reporting data
Do not request dimensions when they are stated
Add a bit more on timestamps.
Move EXPOSE and MAINTAINER to final build stage

Add set_timestamp to false to avoid fetching error from Prometheus
